alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Garden; Grant; Keith (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 23 at 10:29PM CDT until June 23 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN ARTHUR...SOUTHERN GRANT...NORTHWESTERN KEITH AND SOUTHEASTERN GARDEN COUNTIES... At 929 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles northeast of Lewellen, or 16 miles southwest of Arthur, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Arthur, Lewellen, Eagle Gulch Campground, Ruthon, Haythorn Lake, Clear Creek State Wildlife Management Area, McKeag, Otter Creek Campground, Ash Hollow State Historical Park, Jensen Lake, Belmar, Bourquim Hill, Velma and Bluewater Battlefield State Historical Park. This includes the following highways... Highway 61 between mile markers 106 and 127. Highway 92 between mile markers 115 and 130, and near mile marker 165. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for the Panhandle of, southwestern and west central Nebraska. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
